review: Used to be my favorite burger, but that's past.  The Service took it down two stars on this last visit.  The waitress interrupted me twice while I ordered, didn't offer a refill on our lemonade, wasn't around a lot, gave me the wrong bill, just took the bill for someones drinks and spun her back to me without a word, didn't say "Sorry bout that" until I got the new bill, didn't clear the table.    Not the normal service there, but too late.  There are other new places to try. Christi's bar has more burgers for us to taste.

Ive been here two or three times because my mother loves this place. The lemonade is outstanding. The food itself is average. I love the bottomless fries. I wouldnt mind going back again but this place is not a favorite

Corporate policy is to discriminate against families with children.  My family and I went there to celebrate my sons birthday and since my wife does not like their booths, we asked for a table.  Upon being told there would be a 10 to 15 minute wait, I said that we would sit at the community table in the bar area.  I was promptly told that the bar area is only for guest 21 and over.  After I pointed out that there were 4 children in the area, the manager apologized and let us sit there.  Companies line is that they are trying to have an area for adults to be able to relax with out kids.  My response is, you are a family restaurant, stop trying to be a bar where adults come to hang out.

I really don't like to go to chain restaurants, but decided to give it a try with my 15 month old. She loved looking around at everything. The service was great, she was entertained, and I loved my burger! I will definitely be back!
Burgers are overpriced and taste frozen, service is just average.  But what's up with all the flies in the restaurant?  It was ridiculous.  Why would you want to bring your family here?

This is a nice place to stop by after shopping.  Kid friendly and still pretty loud.  Has some pretty nice gluten free choices and reasonable prices.  It is a good go to places and usually moves pretty fast if you don't want to wait a long time and still want decent food.

Best turkey burger around, hands down! They're accomodating about giving you a salad instead of fries, so that's nice too! I used to LOVE the very raspberry limeade, but they changed the recipe and it just SUCKS now!

This place was packed!! I had the patty melt and a beer. Bottomless fries are ridiculous.  There is something to be said about a place that makes hamburgers endlessly as this place does, and consistently makes them well. Each time I've gone, they've been juicy and flavorful. The prices are on point.

We had a great experience this evening. Even though we started out with just water for all four of us, our server, Trevor, was very attentive throughout the evening. Other than the initial 15 minute wait for a table, we never had to wait for anything. Food was fantastic. All while it was dinner rush on a Friday evening. Everything you would want in a casual dining experience was in full force. Well Done.
Super friendly staff  specially Mindy who works the bar/take out area.  Food always a hit but I prefer the turkey patties to the hamburger

I was pleasantly surprised by Red Robin on my first-ever visit. I hadn't been before because I try to avoid chains and I'm a vegetarian so rarely does "burger joint" elicit happy feelings from me. Low and behold, the wide 3 fold menu of various burger options could be turned vegetarian with their garden burger. Whoa! Very pleasant surprise! In the end, I ordered a pretty plain garden burger. It was quite good. They must make their garden burger, because it wasn't a uniform or tight disc but was instead a rice-based patty. It also came with unlimited fries. Their fries are steak-style, and I'm not a big fan in general, but these were okay.  I also ordered a margarita, but what came was a sad attempt. I would not recommend. Wrong taste, wrong texture. Other group members ordered other drinks and they looked and tasted quite good.  Very kid-friendly casual place. Friendly staff. Clean.

For the fact that the burgers are consistent, and the idea that I've never had under- or over-done fries, and that they serve burgers with pink in the middle...I won't go lower than a 2-star.  The burger I usually get, the Burnin' Love (occasionally with a fried egg) with jalapenos and other spicy items...very tasty and worth the visit. But, I can't go higher due to the service level that has never once improved in the times I've been there.  There's always a huge delay between putting in drink orders and receiving them, most notably with anything involving a shake or a float.  Most recently, mine was forgotten, then delivered while eating the aforementioned tasty burger.  I finished it and the burger at the same time, and, rather than offer a refill (as it's a bottomless float - and they're also bottomless fries), my plate and glass were cleared immediately. My little one also wanted ice cream.  As we parents were good without, it didn't make sense to order an entire dessert, so we asked about a scoop of vanilla for her.  Sadly, we were informed that they don't do "just ice cream."  And when asked about how they do ice cream for parties and the full-sized desserts,  she said they serve it then, and that my little one should be sure to come back for her birthday and laughed and walked away.  Seriously?  Wtf? Thinking again about it now, I'm more than a little annoyed about the exchange over the ice cream, and pretty sure that I don't need to go back.

This was our first visit to Red Robin...I don't understand all the fuss... If I wanted a burger from Burger King then I'd go there. Same taste... Husband had the Prime Rib sandwich nothing to brag about (sauce was salty). Milwaukee has a lot of restaurants that offer hamburgers...If you do decide to venture here as far as drinks go (suppose to be a Coke)...the waitress basically handed me a glass of ice. My daughter had the chicken on a stick (kid's menu)...she said they were nasty...I tried one bland and overcooked (rubbery)... Red Robin promotes gourmet(I laugh); you can get these same burgers/menu items anywhere else. Our waitress was attentive until it was time for our bill...she disappeared. This place is NOT worth the wait.

We had an enjoyable evening! Our family of four visited on a busy Saturday night. Our server Danielle was clearly well-trained and personable. I tried a Blood Orange Margarita and my hubby had a Spotted Cow. Burgers were delicious. I had the Red Robin special and he had one with blue cheese.  Both were delicious and cooked a little pink. Coleslaw was fresh and crunchy and onion rings were cooked perfect.  The kids menu was creative laying out main dish, side and drink in pictures to choose from, along side sketches and games to keep the kids busy while you wait. The kiddos had pizza with apples and a corn dog with a fruit cup, both with chocolate milk. It was noisy with lots of action which was perfect for an almost 3 and 4 1/2 year old. The texting you when your table is ready feature if easy to use. We will return!

I have always enjoyed Red Robin.... Specifically for its burgers and bottomless steak fries. However, this location was absolutely horrible. Probably the worst dining experience that I have had in a while. My friend and I waited for over 45 minutes for or food, only to have the manager come over and bring out the wrong meals to us. The manager did try to make up for it by taking the food off of our bill but then when I went to pay for my alcoholic beverages, the server took the cash and did not return with my change or receipt. All in all, horrible management and poor serving ruined my experience at this location. I will not be returning.

Food is always good when it's right.  The service is always terrible. My order is always screwed up. Then I have to get a manager to fix it. It's a pain in the butt to eat here. I like Red Robin, but this location sucks. Just get your food to go and save yourself the headache.

Back in the day, Red Robin was one of my go-to spots for a good burger. Fresh, big, beefy burgers, amazing service, and amazing lemonade....how could one go wrong?  Well, Red Robin has gone wrong. At least in my eyes. The burgers have changed, for the worse big time. Smaller, frozen patties, that are overcooked, service  that is terrible (unless you are friends with the waitress and she sits down at your table like ours did on more than one occasion Saturday night) but hey, the lemonade is still good.  I was kind of shocked at how busy RR was on a Saturday night. People....don't you ever go to non-chain restaurants? I had an excuse to be there, my once a year visit for my birthday burger. Was told there would be a 25 minute wait, got a text 10 minutes later that a table was ready. That was nice.  Service was expected to be slow, and it was. However, after we ordered, things slowed down in the restaurant. So much so that our waitress was able to spend numerous 3-4 minute visits sitting at the booth across from us. They must have been VIP customers, as several waitresses took the opportunity to sit at their table. (former employees i'm guessing) It was just a bit bizarre. We were brought the wrong appetizer, and when pointed out, the guy took them to another table, and then back to the kitchen, and then brought them back out to us and said it was our lucky day and we were getting the full size appetizer. Um, yay? Burgers came out a bit later and man.....they've changed. Like I said, they used to have a really good, beefy burger. Not so much anymore. This burger was overcooked, dry, and just downright awful. It wasn't just mine either....my friend said hers left an awful feeling in her stomach, and I felt the same.  Red Robin, I'll see you for my birthday burger next February, but you've given me no reason to come back anytime sooner.

The hubs and I headed to Red Robin for our first ever gourmet burger experience. Let me rephrase that. We had heard that the burgers here were awesome. I am doing WW and was praying they had some low cal options. Unfortunately, the only things for me to choose from that weren't calorie laden were some veggies, fruit, soup, BOCA burgers (that I can buy at the supermarket) and the salad topped with chicken breast that I chose. Ambience was between Applebee's and diner atmosphere.  Service was pretty slow considering we saw our waitress just standing drinking soda at the bar.  We started with the small stack of onion rings towering at 6. It came with two different sauces and was good. Next came our main dishes. My salad was huge but nothing that I can't get at McDonald's. (8.99 here) My hubby's burger reminded me of a Sonic burger. Again, nothing to write home about. It was pretty small. Our bill was $26.00. Not exactly a cheap lunch. There is too much competition around there for me to go back. I would rather waste my points and go to Kopp's for a huge burger and some ice cream.

Sure, Milwaukee is known for its beer but did you know there are other drink options to whet your whistle? During St. Patrick's Day, you can't get near a standard pub without going insane. It was for that reason that my husband and I decided to see what Irish drink specials from an unlikely source... a chain restaurant! When I saw that the local Red Robins had an Irish Beer Shake, that was all it took to make me a believer! Guinness Draught, Jameson's Irish Whiskey and chocolate ice cream with whip cream on top? Yes, please and make it a double!

I've been to this location a handful of times in the past couple years. I've never had a bad experience. Steak fries are just meh. I usually get a burger with steamed broccoli. It does get pretty loud and busy on weekends which is typical of course.
The bar tender Monday night was SOOOO bad!  She had no customers and spent her time talking to her friends. Our server had to go behind the bar and make our drinks!

Good, the only thing I don't like it the loud crazy kids when it is busy but the food is delish!!!  We always get two different things and then split everything.  The sweet potato fries are great!!!  Love the burgers, wraps and the Fish and Chips!

The food is always good here! The atmosphere is a little noisy, not that they can help the screaming kids that I hear whenever I go there. The fries and the root beer floats are wonderful, I love the onion rings and the mushroom swiss as well. No complaints food wise! Service varies between slow and good paced, but it's been a few times where we needed an order corrected but it has never seemed to be a big deal.
How can you not like their burgers, I always get the mushroom and swiss.  If you like garlic, you will like this one.  good ranch sauce to go with their fries.

I've been coming to Red Robin since they opened here. The servers are usually pretty good (we have specifically enjoyed Rich and Colin). However, the last couple times we've noticed there are no bussers and clean-up for tables is slow. Tables stay dirty while people wait.  We had to ask for refills and they used to be supplied right away.  We ordered a fry refill and never got it.  I think management needs to go back to when things ran really well, because it gets worse every time we come (once or twice every month or so). Summary: Menu is great, food is great, Wait-staff is excellent, kitchen is slow, clean-up/bussing is non-existent, and often done by waiters who seem overwhelmed by lack of help. PS... some sound - proofing would be a wonderful improvement... maybe some insulation in the ceiling? It's so loud all the time!

We stopped here this past Saturday around 1pm. The place was extremely busy. They gave us a 15-20 minute wait time for two people. They take your phone number and text you when your table is ready, which I thought was nice. We went outside, and within a few minutes received a text.  We've frequented many Red Robin restaurants (in several different states) - it's our go-to place for a good meal. The food was good, as to be expected. But the service was less than desired.  We ordered our drinks and meal at the same time. The waitress promptly brought our drinks, and that was the end of good service. When she arrived with our food, she didn't bring napkins or silverware. I had to get them from the waitress station. I asked for some sauce, which she forgot to bring. So when she returned to the table to ask if we were still okay, I asked for the sauce again, which she later brought to me.  I understand the place was busy, but I just didn't feel like the service was up to par.  The food was fantastic as always. I will return to Red Robin, just maybe not this particular location.

We have berm coming here on and off for a while. What made us start coming here more was Karley. If you are ever at the restaurant and Karley is working, ask for her!! Between her personality and knowledge you will not be disappointed.

Terrible service. My water glass had a glob of something stuck to the inside. When I asked for a new one the server didn't apologize, just said ok. There was quite a wait for our food and when we finally got it the fries tasted old. It wasn't until after we got our food that we noticed they hadn't brought us silverware so we had to wait for that too. I usually love Red Robin but this location is understaffed and undesirable.

This place just sucks big time.. we ordered a burnin love sandwich and A1 burger... and a bowl of chilli for myself. The chilli was too salty and entrées just sucked big time.  Our sever was very nice but this was my second try at RR and I am done with this place.

I love Red Robin's burgers! It's always a great option for my friends and I when we are looking for a spot to eat before a movie or our darts league. Some of my favorites include the Royal Red Robin with the fried egg on it. Soo good! Also the Banzai Burger with the pineapple on it is probably my all-time favorite burger from RR. I really like the contrast of the sweet and savory. My roomate and I just stopped in here last week and I saw they have for a limited time, a crab cake burger. I had to try it as I love seafood and crab cakes! It was everything I had imagined and more. The only gripe that I could find with it was the initially shocking $15.00 price tag. Over all I ended up being ok with it since the crab cake was so good and I was leaving happy after dinner!

When the hubby and I are in the mood for a burger, this is one of our go-to places. Red Robin has delicious burgers, with so many different types to choose from. Here's just a few: Guacamole Bacon, Whiskey River BBQ, the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger, Sautéed 'Shroom, and my personal favorite, the Royal Red Robin burger, which comes topped with an egg. You have your choice of "some pink" or "no pink" as far as how you want your burger cooked. The burgers also come with their bottomless steak fries (mmmm...).  If you're looking for something other than a burger, Red Robin has plenty to offer. They also have wraps, sandwiches, soup, salad, chicken and fish, as well as appetizers. They also have a full bar, specialty cocktails, and a selection of bottomless beverages (non alcoholic, of course).  We have always had a good experience here. The staff is friendly and makes sure you're taken care of. Most of the restaurant is open concept and is spacious. It's nice to have this place so close to our house.

So we ordered a pricey burger(it did taste good though), we had big expectations. It arrived and it was so small! The fries were so very few as well. The service was terrible. It was as if our waitress didn't even want to acknowledge us. The place was clean, but we also waited very long for our disappointment. Don't ever plan on going back.

In my quest for good food, I don't normally find them at chains but in life, exceptions can always be made. Not so much at Red Robin. It's not the staff, that was all good. It's not the description or the promise of good food - that was there. Value?  Bonkers.  $20 bucks (with tax & tip) for a burger and fries with a diet coke.  I get this craving, honestly, once or twice per year for a burger. Red Robin is close to work (when this hankering came on) and has the lettuce wrap version like Jimmy Johns that I like (which they screwed up when my burger arrived, anyway) and I remember liking their clam chowder (although who knows if it's fresh or still good, no idea when they change the menu or food distributors - agh, gross ... Food distributors). I opted for the blue cheese burger with onion straws and some sort of spicy sauce (it wasn't), expecting all kinds of flavor. Blue cheese is one of the strongest cheeses out there. Why didn't I taste it? Must be some bunk cheese, not the good stuff. Onion straws? A pile of soggy mess with the flavor of deep frying oil.  Also went with the bottomless fries. Asked for half sweet potato and half steak fries. It's so silly the little half a cup, maybe quarter cup, they put on your plate. Yes, I get the bottomless concept, I went to college. But I don't want to ask and wait for more food. Or stop eating my burger to wait for more fries.  And pickles. Why wouldn't burgers come with pickles? That has got to be one of the cheapest and most logical accompaniments around. Stupid. Anyway, I need a better fix in the next 6-12 mos. when I crave a burger again. This shit just ain't it.

Always a great place to go and sit and watch the families that crowd this place. Food is usually great and if there is a problem, it is dealt with poste-haste. Service, for the most part is excellent.  What keeps this from a higher rating are the prices. Many burger items well over 10 bucks which may not be family friendly. Non the less, we go there quite often.

I used to love going to this place. I had a friend who used to wait tables there for a long time. I was going to try to give a positive review, but service has been poor twice in a row. We got there on a Sunday at 1:30 so I expected a wait, but we got taken to a seat right away. The waitress was quick in getting our drink orders, but then it was downhill fast as the time before. Fifteen minutes went by, and we put in our orders. It took 40 minutes for us to receive our burgers! Again I get the fact it was prime time, but 40 minutes!? I got the mushroom Swiss burger, and as you would imagine, it's full of mushrooms.  As usual (second time) there was no silver wear for me to cut my burger with, so I was picking up the greasy mushrooms with my fingers. I asked the waitress for a second order of fries right away, because once your food is delivered, you won't see them until the end of the meal. When our bill came I gave her my card and royalty card right away... Otherwise I'd be sitting another 45 minutes with greasy fingers from having to eat without silver wear. I say good food, terrible service! Go there if you want no silver wear and have two hours to eat. If your on a schedule I wouldn't ever recommend it. I wondered if it was a company policy to not give out silver wear unless asked?

Have you ever been to a restaurant whose music is so loud that you would willingly tear your own arm off to swap the horrible volume for the cries of a screaming infant? The food is decent,  but it took multiple tries to get the correct order,  because try as we might,  we could not shout loud enough for the server to hear us accurately.  Holding a conversation was absolutely out of the question. Asking for the volume to be turned down? They turn it down for 4 minutes,  then right back up.  I left with a headache.

Honestly its just ok we used to love to come here but the problem is is that I think they have too few waiters or waitress's to each table or there slamming them and they are they never come back for refills.
Carissa our waitress was amazing!!  She was attentive.  She made it a great Birthday for my daughter and at the same time a moment we won't forget.

Not a huge fan of chain restaurants--fortunately, Red Robin was a pleasant surprise! Great Appetizer (Pretzel Bites), attentive, friendly, knowledgable server (Chloe) multiple Burger options, and kid-friendly, festive atmosphere. We'll be back!

I don't go out to eat much, in fact I don't remember the last time my family went out for dinner. At times it is difficult to find a restaurant that has food that is safe for me to eat or accommodating to my dietary needs. My doctor's office even gave me a card that explains I am a bariatric patient, please allow me to order off the children's menu. I can't believe how many places won't let me.  Today I went to Red Robin, I explained my dietary needs, they didn't even want to see the card. They were super accommodating, even told me the ounces of food. The children's menu actually had better choices than most places with healthy sides, many choices too. I was super impressed!  Most places have poor choices on the children's menu.  I was impressed that you could substitute any bun with lettuce, any burger with chicken, turkey or a veggie burger.  This was the best place I went to for accommodations and I was shocked being it was a burger joint. I was scared to go but now happy I went.
I loved the burgers, and fries............. its a nice atmosphere.. with the dim lighting it was kind of romantic...
Ms. Hillory you are the best!! Excellent service always smiling!! Thank you for everything!!! I will b back to see you!

I don't usually give one star, but this is based on the server and whom ever cooked my meal. Went in last night a busy Saturday about 630pm, waited about 15 mins to be seated, no biggy there,we knew it was going to be busy.      Our server took our order, asked how we wanted our burger we both said "little pink" needless to say they were all pink and cold in the middle. I also asked for a second beef patty with extra cheese and without a bun...got a strange look from the server. I asked for the Red Robin special the one with the egg on top of it.. so I asked for the egg to be over medium. I ordered a sangria and what I received was something that had one cherry in it and taste like a dry Merlot with maybe some port added to it. I choked it down and put the empty glass to the end of the table, hoping when she came back to get the glass I would order a beer. The waitress was running around so fast it was hard to get a question or request in to her, she ran by the table, grabbed the glass and zoomed away, never to come back and ask if I wanted another one or something different.       Out comes the burgers, bf wasn't happy with all the raw cold meat,but liked the taste. When I ordered without a bun I asked for extra veggies, didnt get extra veggies. I even sent the egg back bc I wanted an over medium egg on top of my burger, it was over hard. ...my second egg that came back was WAY burnt and over hard again. I even specified how I wanted the egg, with the yolk running and whites hard...told her maybe do over easy and the cook might get it right since my over medium turned over hard ,I was trying to figure out how the cook was thinking but still got a burnt over hard egg.    My burger made it out but my side of broccoli came out later, nice bright broccoli, but with no butter, couldn't find server to ask for some...I really didn't want to ask for anymore since the meal was messed up from the start.    I came here about 6 months ago and was pretty happy with the food and server, but not this time. Won't be going back.
Had the Red Robin standard double cheeseburger. Just thought it was okay. Staff was very friendly. Would go back only if someone else really wants to go there. Overall just okay nothing special.

Ugh.... What a terrible customer service experience! I don't know who was worse the waitress, Joy or the manager who doesn't even wear a name tag. I've had plenty of great food and experiences at other locations but this one left much to be desired. Mix ups on food, okay no big deal --- mix up on checks, okay no big deal --- snotty attitudes when you ask for corrections, it's a big deal. What has happened to customer service that is now acceptable to be condescending and rude to your patrons? There are so many awesome restaurants right here in the South Ridge Mall area that there is absolutely no reason to visit this Red Robin. Our large & profitable party has officially crossed this off the list for our girls weekend.

The only 2 takeaways you need to know from this place: consistently good comfort food, and inconsistent service. Food here is typically always very good. The bottomless fries are dangerous because they're so good you can't stop eating them! Especially after sprinkling on some of the table side Red Robin seasoning and dipping then in a slew of dipping choices (Thai chili and sweet and spicy ketchup are my choices). I've tried multiple apps and entrees and I've never been disappointed. Service here is what turns this place from a 4-5 star place to a 3 for me. I've been to this location a handful of times and it's always a different experience. Sometimes you'll get an attentive nice server who you will have no complaints about, and sometimes you'll have a rude server who you'll also have to flag down to get a refill or my fries because they seemingly forgot about you. Though I give it a 3 star, I will be back for the food, and cross my fingers for good service!

*This location is currently in the middle of renovating.  Service here is truly hit or miss. We have seemingly had great servers who are on the watch for if we need anything, and then servers who seemingly forget they are waiting on us. The biggest frustration with the servers are when they think showing you how to use the tabletop electronic payment system will be of assistance. It's not! I could have used it if I wanted to... But many folks, like me, prefer to get their orders taken the old fashion, face-to-face way. I don't think it should be assumed or implied that not using this device is doing your waiter/waitress a disservice, but some staff at this location seem to take it personally when patrons don't use it.  Food is generally great! For a place that specializes in burgers, that it super apparent. I've tried a slew of burgers here (the Banzai being my new favorite) and they are each grilled the way you ask for them and super flavorful. It's easy to substitute buns for a lettuce wrapped burgers for less cals, or bottomless French fries for bottomless other sides (fruit, veggies, soup, etc.). It's great that the menu is so customizable. The one thing I would stray away from is the chicken. The last time I ordered chicken, it was on a salad and it was severely underdone. They got me fresh new chicken, and it was inedible. Their response to my frustration was that they are going through a new vendor for their chicken products and there have been a lot of complaints about it by others, as well. My recommendation is to just plain stay away from grilled chicken sandwiches, wraps and salads in order to avoid disappointment.  Overall, this is a decent place to dine, with the extreme upside being the quality of the burgers/fries and the occasional super attentive wait staff.
Emily is the best waitress ever, she was so amazing and should be the president of red robin

Over priced for me. Just had a takeout order with barely any french fries.  For place that gives u bottom less fries when u dine in, u would think that would be more generous.  Pay 10 bucks for an average tasting burger and minimal fries. Gift card is the only reason I  ordered from there. Life too short to waste time eating here again!!

My family ordered three burgers all to be cooked "medium well."   My burger was so rare that it was cold in the center and dripping bloody juice, the 2nd burger was burned with thick black, foul tasting char on it, and the third burger was actually cooked right.  Very disappointing to get only one of three entrees right.  The cup of tortilla soup was good, but the serving size was laughable.  Literally had less than 4 tablespoons of soup in it!!  Everyone at my table was laughing at how absurdly tiny the bowl was.  Kind of insulting to serve something like that to a customer.

I used to love Red Robin!  Today was a big disappointment...they have cut down on quality and quantity. I tried the new "Buzz Mac 'n' Cheese Tavern Double burger!   The macaroni and cheese tasted spoiled and the quality of beef was awful.  The ground beef patty's texture was like clay and it had absolutely no flavor.  They should stop the TV commercial with bottomless fries.  It's almost like they account for all their potatoes...hard for them to let go!  Potato famine or something!  Boo Yah is right!  Never will I go to another red robin!

I have visited this location a few times. And have had good experiences each time. The burgers are always great, and can be customized if you want. I have to agree with other reviews about the wait time. Depending on time of day, it could be a wait to be seated and served. But considering this, I'm thinking most restaurants are busy at 1pm on a Saturday. My visit today was great. Our server was very attentive and very nice. Even the manager came over to see that all was well. I will continue to eat here. We love it.

This place is just miserable!! I'm 0-5 my last 5 attempts at going here. The wait is always extremely long yet tables will be empty. Then they text you when your table is ready yet most of the time while I'm told the wait is 30 minutes they will text me to tell me sorry your wait is now 60 minutes!! What kind of way is this to run a business? Horrible! Avoid like the plague, Milwaukee Burger Company is a better option with a better staff and way better service, plus the atmosphere is just all around better!!

This place is not what it used to be. You are taking a risk at ordering any chicken product because chances are its not cooked. I seriously can't tell you how many times this has happened to me. But they always manage to suck me in with a free birthday burger available to its Royality Rewards Members. My kids like the food, so I figure why not? In the last year or so they have tried to class up the place, but its so obnoxiously loud, some nicer décor can't enhance the place. Our most recent visit I couldn't help but just laugh at our bottomless fries. When we were given our main courses we asked for more fries right away because we each received about 8 on our plate. 15 minutes later, we finally got our second serving of fries. For 2 adults and 2 kids, we were given 10 fries.  I wish I was making his up. We just laughed and again asked for more fries right away. 10 more minutes passes and we got a few more this time around. This is probably the biggest annoyance. Our food was ok. Nothing exciting, but not all that great either. We likely won't be back until we get our next birthday coupon.

So, I'm back! We tried Red Robin's and let me tell you 5 reasons. It to go there. 1st, the employees frighten you with a birthday song and clap unexpectedly in your ear. I have to visit a doctor now cause I think I burst my eardrum. 2nd: the table Ipad device entertainment BS is very con like. We were charged a fee for playing trivia and didn't even get a notice it cost money. I have to work a second job now cause the bill was so expensive. 3rd: what restaurant serves chips with appetizer wings that are supposed to come before the entree but came after. Am I supposed to eat my burger get full them try to eat some wings with 2 pieces of crumbled  blue cheese on them. 4th: I thought a burger cooked medium meant it wasn't pink, I guess Red Robin cooks have a different idea of what medium burger looks like. I'm afraid for my friends lives who ate these raw burgers. 5th: eating is hard to do with no napkins or silverware. That's the case for this meal when i was served my food with nothing to assist in eating and cleaning myself and wiping and touching. 6th: the dollar cheese on my chicken sandwich. I didn't know a slice of cheese cost a dollar in America, I guess we are living in communist Sweden. The only reason it's not a 0 star was cause the waitress was nice and pretty. DONT GO

Mediocre at best for both the food and service. Ordered mine "pink" it was very well done. My wife ordered her burger with the egg over medium, it came sunnyside up. Ordered more frys before I was half done and they came when we were through with our burgers. 1st and last time I'll go there.
My dad had the prime chophouse burger, and it was tasty. I ordered from the double tavern menu and I recommend you stay away from it. Very under seasoned and bland. The steak fries were a hit!

My last experience at this location involved 3 days of food poisoning illness. I had the guacamole burger. The waitress was good but this experience rated a 2 star just because she was fast and courteous.

Tonight our visit to Red Robin just wasn't a great visit. In fact the last 2 visits there have been on the decline. Tonight our food was over cooked and had condiments that we asked not be included. Our waiter was good and we saw he had some difficult tables (families with multiple kids) that he needed to pay special attention to. We noticed that even though they seemed amply staffed all of the wait staff were rushing about dealing with their tables and the food was backing up under the heat lamps on the kitchen counter. The kitchen support staff was trying help as they were expediting and bringing food to the table. The manager on the other hand was of no assistance. We are used to seeing management staff checking in with the tables. This manager did none of that nor did he assist his staff. He just seemed to be checking restaurant functions on a terminal. At the end we were not spoken to when we left and the manager was standing at the welcome/seating desk. It was truly a less than stellar experience.  Marring a family Anniversary gathering. One more bad experience will cause this family favorite will be taken off our list. Truly disappointed.
Cold food. Dysfunctional wait staff. Constant bickering. Manager had zero leadership over staff.

We never got seated. I don't know how good it bad the food is. We were a group of nine. We arrived and we're told the wait would 25-30 min, after 30 minutes we were told our table would be ready shortly. Another 15 minutes go by and then we're told they don't know how much longer. After nearly an hour we talk to the manager also tells us that he doesn't know how much longer. We figured our best option was to leave.

The burgers are good here but there is always something wrong with my order every time I come to this location. Last night was no different. My group received fries that literally looked like someone had chewed them, spit them out, and then stepped on them. My wife got sweet potatoe fries that couldn't have been in the oil for more than 10 seconds, just completely undercooked. We also ordered the donut tower for dessert and they didn't sprinkle them with sugar as they are supposed to be. The waiter was ok, nothing great.

Red Robin on Edgerton in Greenfield is a favorite spot for burgers, until yesterday!   Dirty table tops, dusty ledges and memorabilia, unfriendly wait staff, tepid food, no offer of more fries.   Dining area plus bar only had 12 booths/tables occupied yet it took 27 minutes to receive our food.   Paying at table proved to be a chore as the amount was incorrect so I signal for our server then watched the light blink for 7 minutes before I took the entire machine with me as I searched for our server.  Once found she did adjust the bill to the correct amount. This location is in a downward spiral to oblivion!

I took my child to this restaurant once. Just once. We ordered burgers, fries, and a couple drinks. When my fruity drink arrived, it literally tasted like sun tan lotion. It made you wince after the first swallow, and you didn't want to take another. When my burger arrived after a lengthy wait, it was covered in so much slop that it completely soaked through both sides of the bun so that it was entirely mush. It was practically inedible. I'm not a super picky person when it comes to food, but this was one of the grossest restaurant meals I'd ever had. When they brought me a bill that was over thirty dollars, not including tip... I was done. Thirty dollars for burgers when Kopp's is right down the street? You must be out of your damn mind. We never went back, and never will.

We went to Red Robin near the mall before shopping for last minute gifts.  Food was good, service was great and the restaurant was busy with holiday shoppers.  We gave it 3 stars because they seemed a bit short staffed on the floor, and at times we had a hard time getting our servers attention.  The food is always consistent at this Red Robin location.
